abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Fourth
            Telecommunications Project for Pakistan was successful. The
            project was executed well, it has made a positive impact on
            international as well as domestic long distance services,
            its sustainability is likely, and both the Bank and the
            Borrower performed satisfactorily. Several lessons can be
            learned from this project. First, complex financing
            transactions and related procurement activities require
            added sophistication in the handling of foreign financiers
            and suppliers. Second, it would be beneficial to create a
            small specialized unit inside the Directorate General of
            T&T (Telegraph and Telephone Department) that is
            responsible for handling complex financial and procurement
            questions, such as bidding with price and teams, and
            coordinating multilateral and bilateral sources of
            financing. Lastly, the new unit should be staffed with
            highly qualified employees that will receive specialized
            training in financial matters.

docna.cdata!:
Pakistan - Fourth Telecommunications Project
            : Loan 2122 - Loan Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Pakistan - Fourth
            Telecommunications Project : Loan 2122 - Loan Agreement - Conformed

abstracts.cdata!:
The project would consist of: (a)
            provision of local network facilities for an additional
            52,000 subscriber lines; (b) provision of toll-ticketing
            equipment for about 240,000 subscriber lines; (c) an
            increase of about 2,000 circuits on existing
            subscribers' long-distance dialing routes; (d)
            installation of a new l,800-channel microwave system; (e)
            expansion of subsidiary routes providing an additional 500
            circuits to existing and about 200 new small exchanges, and
            provision of an additional 300 public call offices in rural
            areas; (f) extension of telex and telegraph facilities; (g)
            provision of three additional wideband microwave system
            channels, an earth station, and a new international gateway
            exchange; (h) installation of a coaxial cable to expand and
            improve international communications; (i) replacement of
            local cable and exchange equipment and rehabilitation of a
            coaxial cable; and (j) provision of computing facilities for
            subscribers' billing and information processing, and
            related consultant services.
